snippet: One shot confers lifetime protection and the “booster shot” given at 10 years is no longer necessary, the World Health Organization said.
abstract: World Health Organization announces that one yellow fever vaccine confers lifetime protection and customary 'booster shot' given at 10 years old is no longer necessary.
lead_paragraph: One shot confers lifetime protection and the “booster shot” given at 10 years is no longer necessary, the World Health Organization said.

headline.main: Single Yellow Fever Shot Offers Lifetime Protection, W.H.O. Says
headline.print_headline: New Guidance on Yellow Fever Shots
